intro: Leontodon glaber, commonly known as the rough leontodon, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are linear and rough to the touch, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Leontodon glaber is often found in open habitats and is known for its resilience to environmental changes.
